summary: Something Really Major From Ant-Man and The Wasp May Appear in Avengers: Endgame
title: Something Really Major From Ant-Man and The Wasp May Appear in Avengers: Endgame
body:
Something Really Major From Ant-Man and The Wasp May Appear in #AvengersEndgame

Those who haven’t watched Ant-Man and The Wasp are probably going to want to sit down and do it before seeing Avengers: Endgame, as it looks like some really big concepts introduced in that movie will play a big role in the new Avengers.

Sometimes, trailers released on other video platforms may contain footage that isn’t meant to be seen due to how the widescreen cropping on YouTube would…

View On WordPress

summary: El más reciente trailer de Avengers: Endgame tuvo 268 millones de reproducciones en las primeras 24 horas, es el segundo trailer...
body: El más reciente trailer de Avengers: Endgame tuvo 268 millones de reproducciones en las primeras 24 horas, es el segundo trailer de película más visto en ese periodo de tiempo solo detrás del primer teaser de Endgame que se estrenó en diciembre.

blog.description: - Randa - 27 - TX - Cis she/her - My Paypal - Gaymer - Full-time fangirl - Writer/aspiring producer - Current obsessions: Critical Role, Killing Eve, & the MCU - Lifelong fan of superheroes, Star Wars, & fantasy - History buff, feminist, LGBT activist.

summary: My hopes for Carol in Endgame:
title: My hopes for Carol in Endgame:
body:
• She isn’t nerfed for no reason. (This is post-Snap… there’s no reason to nerf her when even her going Binary won’t fix what happened.)
  • Lots of interactions with all the different Avengers. Obviously there’ll be at least one with Thor. But I think we all want some Captain confusion and some Tony Stark vs Carol Snark. Oh and ALL THE GIRLS BONDING/TEAMING UP!
  • PLENTY OF SCREENTIME!
  • No male gaze-y shit.
  • She’s a good part of the solution to beating Thanos but not necessarily the one to land the “killing blow” since that should be Nebula, Tony, Thor, or any combination thereof. They deserve it.
  • Mentions of her past with Fury, his naming of the Avengers, and possibly the eye situation.
  • HER CHARACTER IS CONSISTENT! 
  • GOOSE?! (An interaction with her and Rocket would be GREAT!)
  • 80s/90s references EVERYWHERE!
  • And honestly just give her her Captain Marvel hair back lol.

Y’all feel free to add things but if you disrespect my girl I might snap harder than Thanos.

summary: The Russos lied about the toy leak (they insisted the Quantum suits weren’t going to be a thing and that the toy leak was...
body:
The Russos lied about the toy leak (they insisted the Quantum suits weren’t going to be a thing and that the toy leak was misleading).

I’m really hoping they lied when they said only 2 original Avengers will survive. 

Because they’re lying liars who lie.

title: Time
body:
Summary: All Tony has left is time and guilt, but it’s never enough. (A drabble about Tony’s time adrift in space.)

Prompt: “If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.” 

Warnings: Angst. It’s Tony alone with his thoughts, so what do you expect really? 

Words: 1.1k

A/N: Requested by @blackwidws like forever ago. I’m sorry this took so long, and I know that it probably isn’t what you expected, but I got the idea for it and had to run with it. I was actually supposed to be doing homework, but it couldn’t wait. I just hope this isn’t trash. 

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

The words were spoken from soft lips, sharpened into something cutting with green eyes that begged him to stay. They were said with a love that he didn’t deserve, with a pain that he caused to often.

It hurt, remembering her like this, but Tony thought that the worst part was that he knew she would never actually say those words, no matter how much it was warranted. She would never hurt him that way, the way he hurt her. Hurt them.

He dreamt of them often. His family.

This time it had been Pepper, eyes betrayed and hands reaching for him as he left her behind once again. Another mission, another world-saving-scenario awaiting him. Empty promises of his return given, a plea that he couldn’t shake returned.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

But other times it was Rhodey. Rhodey who would insist he wait for him. Rhodey who would put his life on the line for Tony over and over. Rhodey who got left behind, never to be seen again.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

Occasionally it was Steve, still hurt by decisions made in that bunker. Still waiting for things to return to a normal that simply didn’t exist anymore. Still trying to hold together a team that Tony had helped destroy.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

Often it was Peter. The kid that had become… something to him, begging for him to let him go. To let him live a normal life. To let him live long enough to have a life.

Those hurt the most, if only because he knew that he would only exist in his dreams now.

He saw them all, shifting and changing every time he closed his life. Pepper, Rhodey, Steve, Peter, Happy, Bruce, Clint, Natasha, Thor, Sam… The list went on and on, his guilt as infinite as he had once assumed the universe was.

Tony used to wake from these dreams gasping for air, pain and hope and relief and terror comingling in a way that confused his senses until he realized that it was just another dream.

Now he welcomed them like an old friend, cherished these brief moments when he could see Pepper’s face even when it was contorted into something like hatred. He longed to share a hug with his best friend, a smile with the kid, a witty retort with a master assassin. Now he woke up slowly, reluctantly, wishing for nothing but more time.

Time.

It had become a strange concept. Tony wished he could say that he had lost track of it, that he had no idea how long it had been since he had been stranded in space with an alien companion and a dwindling supply of, well… you name it.

They would run out of food on day 64.

They would run out of water on day 67.

They would run out of oxygen on day 72.

And according to the countdown he was running through his suit—what remained of it anyway—and the pounding in his head that reminded him of what he had lost and what he had left to lose it was currently day 58.

It had been 58 days since he had made the decision to leave Pepper behind with little to no explanation.

It had been 58 days since he had gambled his life for the chance to save the world just one last time. (Had he known, even then, that there was really no such thing?)

It had been 58 days since he had unknowingly dragged a kidalong for the ride.

It had been 58 days since he had sworn to do what he could to protect him, even as the universe ended around them.

It had been 58 days since he had held that same kid—his kid—in his arms as he turned to dust.

58 days since he had seen the love of his life. No time left for one last apology.

58 days since he had cracked a joke with his best friend. No time left for one last impossible mission.

58 days since he had shared some terribly mediocre advice with his protégé. Nothing left of him at all.

All Tony had left was time, but it wasn’t nearly enough.

He still had to find a way home. He still had to save the universe, save his home, save his family.

How many of them were even left?

What would he find, when—ifhe even made it back to Earth?

Pepper with grief and accusations in her eyes?

Rhodey with a sad smile and a heartbreaking hug?

Bruce, looking even more broken?

Steve, fiercely determined as always even as he gave Tony that look that told him it was all his fault?

Aunt May, looking for a nephew that would never return?

Or would he find none of them at all? He had no way to know who lived and who died. No idea what remained of his world.

He wasn’t sure that he even wanted to know. Thought maybe it was best that he just die out here, blissfully unaware of what happened to those he loved most.

But Tony was a hero, despite what he thought, and heroes didn’t wait for Death to come. They went looking for her with raised fists and fire in their eyes, ready to fight for the lives of innocents.

Tony had failed at that once. Could still taste the ash in his mouth. Could still feel the grief heavy in his heart. But he would be damned if he let them down again.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

With those words ringing in his ears, Tony got up and got to work. He didn’t have much time, but he still had today. And today he would help his blue alien friend—Nebula, as she reminded him every time he tried out a new nickname—find their way back to Earth. Back to the fight. Back to his family.

He would be foolish not to realize that it may still not be enough. That a plucky attitude and an assortment of tools weren’t always enough to save the day.

So he would make contingencies—a message, one last chance at goodbye. A gesture of hope for the future, even if he wasn’t a part of it.

But that wasn’t something he needed to tackle today, he decided as he took the hammer Nebula offered him the moment he stepped foot in their makeshift lab.

There was time for goodbyes, for apologies later. Right now, there was work to do.

A world to save. A son to avenge. A titan’s ass to kick.

Tony would make the time, or he would die trying.

It had been 58 days since he had held that same kid—his kid—in his arms as he turned to dust.

58 days since he had seen the love of his life. No time left for one last apology.

58 days since he had cracked a joke with his best friend. No time left for one last impossible mission.

58 days since he had shared some terribly mediocre advice with his protégé. Nothing left of him at all.

All Tony had left was time, but it wasn’t nearly enough.

He still had to find a way home. He still had to save the universe, save his home, save his family.

How many of them were even left?

What would he find, when—ifhe even made it back to Earth?

Pepper with grief and accusations in her eyes?

Rhodey with a sad smile and a heartbreaking hug?

Bruce, looking even more broken?

Steve, fiercely determined as always even as he gave Tony that look that told him it was all his fault?

Aunt May, looking for a nephew that would never return?

Or would he find none of them at all? He had no way to know who lived and who died. No idea what remained of his world.

He wasn’t sure that he even wanted to know. Thought maybe it was best that he just die out here, blissfully unaware of what happened to those he loved most.

But Tony was a hero, despite what he thought, and heroes didn’t wait for Death to come. They went looking for her with raised fists and fire in their eyes, ready to fight for the lives of innocents.

Tony had failed at that once. Could still taste the ash in his mouth. Could still feel the grief heavy in his heart. But he would be damned if he let them down again.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

With those words ringing in his ears, Tony got up and got to work. He didn’t have much time, but he still had today. And today he would help his blue alien friend—Nebula, as she reminded him every time he tried out a new nickname—find their way back to Earth. Back to the fight. Back to his family.

He would be foolish not to realize that it may still not be enough. That a plucky attitude and an assortment of tools weren’t always enough to save the day.

So he would make contingencies—a message, one last chance at goodbye. A gesture of hope for the future, even if he wasn’t a part of it.

But that wasn’t something he needed to tackle today, he decided as he took the hammer Nebula offered him the moment he stepped foot in their makeshift lab.

There was time for goodbyes, for apologies later. Right now, there was work to do.

A world to save. A son to avenge. A titan’s ass to kick.

Tony would make the time, or he would die trying.
trail.content:
Summary: All Tony has left is time and guilt, but it’s never enough. (A drabble about Tony’s time adrift in space.)

Prompt: “If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.” 

Warnings: Angst. It’s Tony alone with his thoughts, so what do you expect really? 

Words: 1.1k

A/N: Requested by @blackwidws like forever ago. I’m sorry this took so long, and I know that it probably isn’t what you expected, but I got the idea for it and had to run with it. I was actually supposed to be doing homework, but it couldn’t wait. I just hope this isn’t trash. 

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

The words were spoken from soft lips, sharpened into something cutting with green eyes that begged him to stay. They were said with a love that he didn’t deserve, with a pain that he caused to often.

It hurt, remembering her like this, but Tony thought that the worst part was that he knew she would never actually say those words, no matter how much it was warranted. She would never hurt him that way, the way he hurt her. Hurt them.

He dreamt of them often. His family.

This time it had been Pepper, eyes betrayed and hands reaching for him as he left her behind once again. Another mission, another world-saving-scenario awaiting him. Empty promises of his return given, a plea that he couldn’t shake returned.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

But other times it was Rhodey. Rhodey who would insist he wait for him. Rhodey who would put his life on the line for Tony over and over. Rhodey who got left behind, never to be seen again.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

Occasionally it was Steve, still hurt by decisions made in that bunker. Still waiting for things to return to a normal that simply didn’t exist anymore. Still trying to hold together a team that Tony had helped destroy.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

Often it was Peter. The kid that had become… something to him, begging for him to let him go. To let him live a normal life. To let him live long enough to have a life.

Those hurt the most, if only because he knew that he would only exist in his dreams now.

He saw them all, shifting and changing every time he closed his life. Pepper, Rhodey, Steve, Peter, Happy, Bruce, Clint, Natasha, Thor, Sam… The list went on and on, his guilt as infinite as he had once assumed the universe was.

Tony used to wake from these dreams gasping for air, pain and hope and relief and terror comingling in a way that confused his senses until he realized that it was just another dream.

Now he welcomed them like an old friend, cherished these brief moments when he could see Pepper’s face even when it was contorted into something like hatred. He longed to share a hug with his best friend, a smile with the kid, a witty retort with a master assassin. Now he woke up slowly, reluctantly, wishing for nothing but more time.

Time.

It had become a strange concept. Tony wished he could say that he had lost track of it, that he had no idea how long it had been since he had been stranded in space with an alien companion and a dwindling supply of, well… you name it.

They would run out of food on day 64.

They would run out of water on day 67.

They would run out of oxygen on day 72.

And according to the countdown he was running through his suit—what remained of it anyway—and the pounding in his head that reminded him of what he had lost and what he had left to lose it was currently day 58.

It had been 58 days since he had made the decision to leave Pepper behind with little to no explanation.

It had been 58 days since he had gambled his life for the chance to save the world just one last time. (Had he known, even then, that there was really no such thing?)

It had been 58 days since he had unknowingly dragged a kidalong for the ride.

It had been 58 days since he had sworn to do what he could to protect him, even as the universe ended around them.

It had been 58 days since he had held that same kid—his kid—in his arms as he turned to dust.

58 days since he had seen the love of his life. No time left for one last apology.

58 days since he had cracked a joke with his best friend. No time left for one last impossible mission.

58 days since he had shared some terribly mediocre advice with his protégé. Nothing left of him at all.

All Tony had left was time, but it wasn’t nearly enough.

He still had to find a way home. He still had to save the universe, save his home, save his family.

How many of them were even left?

What would he find, when—ifhe even made it back to Earth?

Pepper with grief and accusations in her eyes?

Rhodey with a sad smile and a heartbreaking hug?

Bruce, looking even more broken?

Steve, fiercely determined as always even as he gave Tony that look that told him it was all his fault?

Aunt May, looking for a nephew that would never return?

Or would he find none of them at all? He had no way to know who lived and who died. No idea what remained of his world.

He wasn’t sure that he even wanted to know. Thought maybe it was best that he just die out here, blissfully unaware of what happened to those he loved most.

But Tony was a hero, despite what he thought, and heroes didn’t wait for Death to come. They went looking for her with raised fists and fire in their eyes, ready to fight for the lives of innocents.

Tony had failed at that once. Could still taste the ash in his mouth. Could still feel the grief heavy in his heart. But he would be damned if he let them down again.

“If you cared about me, you wouldn’t do this.”

With those words ringing in his ears, Tony got up and got to work. He didn’t have much time, but he still had today. And today he would help his blue alien friend—Nebula, as she reminded him every time he tried out a new nickname—find their way back to Earth. Back to the fight. Back to his family.

He would be foolish not to realize that it may still not be enough. That a plucky attitude and an assortment of tools weren’t always enough to save the day.

So he would make contingencies—a message, one last chance at goodbye. A gesture of hope for the future, even if he wasn’t a part of it.

But that wasn’t something he needed to tackle today, he decided as he took the hammer Nebula offered him the moment he stepped foot in their makeshift lab.

There was time for goodbyes, for apologies later. Right now, there was work to do.

A world to save. A son to avenge. A titan’s ass to kick.

Tony would make the time, or he would die trying.

But other times it was Rhodey. Rhodey who would insist he wait for him. Rhodey who would put his life on the line for Tony over and over. Rhodey who got left behind, never to be seen again.

Occasionally it was Steve, still hurt by decisions made in that bunker. Still waiting for things to return to a normal that simply didn’t exist anymore. Still trying to hold together a team that Tony had helped destroy.

summary: Asked if “Avengers 4” will mark his last outing in uniform, he answered, “Tough to say.” Addressing the subject on Stagecraft,...
body:
Asked if “Avengers 4” will mark his last outing in uniform, he answered, “Tough to say.” Addressing the subject on Stagecraft, Variety‘s theater podcast, Evans discussed his current Broadway run in “Lobby Hero,” his theater-kid roots and, of course, whether there’s a future for him in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. “Part of you almost kind of thinks: Well, if we end on the right note… and I think it really kind of does. The scripts they have are really beautiful and really well written.”

“They do such a good job,” he continued about Marvel and the upcoming “Avengers” films. “It’s really sweet and lovely and just special, and everyone really has a nice tight plot and story arc. Part of you almost doesn’t want to mess that up. … I guess it depends. It’s hard to know where your head’s gonna be at in a few years.”

Chris Evans

Part of you almost doesn’t want to mess that up. … I guess it depends. It’s hard to know where your head’s gonna be at in a few years.”

body: Just a little theory about Avengers: Endgame. I noticed in the second trailer that Captain Marvel, Thor and Bruce Banner aren’t with the rest of the remaining Avengers, wearing the new uniform. Well what if they’re left behind because Carol and Thor will be the main energy source for the Quantum Realm and Bruce will be the one to operate. Idk just a theory.

summary: Massive ‘Avengers: Endgame’ leak spoils hero deaths, a surprise villain, credits scenes, and more
title: Massive ‘Avengers: Endgame’ leak spoils hero deaths, a surprise villain, credits scenes, and more
excerpt: The hardest part when reporting on spoilers for movies that you want to see yourself is that you’ll know ahead of time what’s about to go down. Take the credits scenes from Captain Marvel that leak…
description:
You know what sucks about leaks/spoilers like this that are probably more legit than not?

The fan theories/speculation/made-up spoilers are always 1000x more interesting.

Like–

–the one posted to Reddit that has Thanos trying to stop the Avengers from undoing the snap because their actions are leading to the destruction of reality itself. Far and away more interesting than anything posted in this article. And yet, this article’s spoilers are probably, annoyingly, disappointingly accurate.

The fan theories/speculation/made-up spoilers are always 1000x more interesting.

Like–

title: Media Questions Of The Week
body:
Why wasn’t Danai Gurira’s name listed at the top of the Avengers: Endgame poster? 

Will Jussie Smollett’s Empire character Jamal Lyon be recast with a different actor?
